snippet: Gov. Rick Perry on Monday signed a bill that will reduce to 5 from 15 the number of standardized tests that Texas high school students must pass to graduate.
abstract: Gov Rick Perry signs bill that will reduce to 5 from 15 number of standardized tests that Texas high school students must pass to graduate.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Rick Perry on Monday signed a bill that will reduce to 5 from 15 the number of standardized tests that Texas high school students must pass to graduate.

headline.main: Texas: State Tests for Graduation Cut to 5 From 15
headline.print_headline: Texas: State Tests For Graduation Cut To 5 From 15
